ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with this course compared to others you have taken was:
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
How would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other F&ES courses you have taken?
Given the course objectives, the level of intellectual challenge of the material covered was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The class helped me think more critically about some of the solutions/approaches/discourse that are typically promoted.
The course provides understanding of the path dependency framework and teaches the students how to apply it to a real issue.

I developed a new way of looking at the world and learned a new method of performing both policy analysis and policy creation. This is the only class at FES where I have learned a coherent method for performing policy analysis, in spite of having taken many classes with "policy analysis" in the title.

narratives.question_text: How well did the knowledge, skills, and insights gained in this class align with your expectations?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of the course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Engaging lectures, interesting and challenging final project, insightful readings Weaknesses: The organization of this class could be improved (some changes were made last minute, some readings were not always easily accessible on Canvas).

This was one of the most rewarding courses I have ever taken (undergrad and grad combined). While the content was repeated at times and the course could have been organized a bit better, the content we covered was incredibly interesting and important, and I anticipate that it will guide my thinking for the rest of my career.

narratives.question_text: What advice would you give to a student considering taking this class?
comments: Great class, with a heavy workload. Make sure you have enough time to do all the readings and really understand and digest the material before coming to class every week. Discussions are very involved.
Unfortunately it won't be offered again, but I would STRONGLY advise anyone working on climate issues or interested in policy analysis to take this class.
